cards

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • cards.Card
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnswerCard, QuestionCard

    public class Card
extends Object
    A type object that represents a card. The type of card is determined by which subclass(QuestionCard or AnswerCard) is used. The class card by its self is never intended to be used, but is meant to be used for its subclasses constructors and methods. The classes QuestionCard and AnswerCard are different because questionCards allow the card to require the user to play or draw a certain number of cards.
    Since:
    CAH1.0
    Version:
    CAH1.0
    Author:
    Holt Maki
    See Also:
    Deck, QuestionCard, AnswerCard

        private CardHistory history

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(String card)
        Creates a card. The type of card is determined by which subclass(QuestionCard or AnswerCard) is used. The class card by its self is never intended to be used, but is meant to be used for its subclasses constructors and methods. The classes QuestionCard and AnswerCard are different because questionCards allow the card to require the user to play or draw a certain number of cards.
        Parameters:
        card - - the writing that will be on the card. cardString = card.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
        See Also:
        AnswerCard, QuestionCard

    • Method Detail

      • addTag

        public void addTag(Tag aTag)
        Adds a tag to the card. This allows cards to be sorted by the computer so that it can better understand what people find funny. It is also used by impersonators to best imitate the the person that it is impersonating.
        Parameters:
        {@link - #aTag} - the Tag that will be attached to the card.
        aTag - - The Tag that will be added to the Card.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
        See Also:
        Tag

      • setCardString

        protected void setCardString(String cardStr)
        Sets cardString.
        Parameters:
        cardStr - - The string that cardString is being set to.
        Since:
        CAH1.0

      • getCardString

        public String getCardString()
        Gets the writing on the card.
        Returns:
        cardString - The String that is made up of the text that the card has written on it.
        Since:
        CAH1.0
